title: Larry Rothschild out as New York Yankees pitching coach after nine seasons
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Game 5 was setting up to be a series defining game and then the Nationals received devastating news from their ace pitcher and the Astros capitalized. As Trysta Krick details, Washington is brink while the Astros are one game away from a classic comeback. USA TODAY

NEW YORK — Larry Rothschild is out as the Yankees pitching coach.

Yankees organizational meetings began on Monday and the club announced that Rothschild, 65, would not be returning for a 10th season.

"I want to personally thank Larry for his near decade of commitment to this organization,'' Yankees GM Brian Cashman said in a statement.

"Larry cares deeply about his craft and the pitchers under his tutelage and he played a significant role in our successes over the past nine seasons.''

The next Yankees pitching coach could be someone steeped in analytics, as has been the trend within the organization and the game in general.
description: With Larry Rothschild out, the next Yankees pitching coach could be someone steeped in analytics, as has been the trend with the organization and MLB.
